intro: Adenophora howozana, commonly known as the Korean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Korea. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, with lance-shaped leaves and clusters of blue to purple flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight. Adenophora howozana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
